intro: Actinospermum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower star-pear, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring hairy stems and oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals that are fused at the base. Actinospermum uniflorum is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
